report_title: Online Book Sales in the US
executive_summary: Online book sellers sell books online, including e-books and audiobooks. The industry is dominated by Amazon.com Inc. (Amazon), which popularized the sale of books online and was essential to the uptake of the e-book industry. Amazon has grown to account for more than four-fifths of all revenue from books sold online; as a result, many industry trends apply to and are a direct result of Amazon. The industry has continued to grow at a rapid pace as e-commerce has grown in popularity. Key to the industry's growth has been the rise of e-books, tied to the proliferation of e-readers such as Amazon's kindle and tablets like Apple's iPad.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online retail sales have continued to rise
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online retail sales have continued to rise, and so too has the retail sale of books.
The proliferation of mobile device connections, such as smartphones and tablets, has further facilitated growth by giving consumers the opportunity to shop on-the-go.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Mobile apps for tailored shopping experiences
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Sellers have introduced mobile apps to tailor their shopping experiences to consumers' buying habits, suggesting titles consumers are likely to enjoy and notifying them of new releases.
Because of the stimulus during the COVID-19 pandemic, consumers were in a better position to purchase all varieties of books, especially more expensive

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Online growth prospects stay the course
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Following the acceleration of e-commerce during COVID-19, growth prospects for online retail and, in turn, online book sales are expected to remain strong.

With leisure time expected to remain pressured, demand for entertainment products that facilitate multitasking like audiobooks will likely continue to rise. Growing education levels will also benefit the industry moving forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consolidated landscape contends with legal hurdles
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will remain firmly in control by Amazon barring unforeseen challenges. The company's vast scale, ability to offer lower prices and rapid delivery times will remain unrivaled by competitors.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Ongoing legal challenges aimed at Amazon
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: There has been increasing discussion at the federal level of addressing the monopoly power of large tech companies such as Amazon, which could alter its existing business model.

industry_definition: This industry is composed of operators that sell books online, including e-books and audio books. Brick-and-mortar sales of these products are not included in the report.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Number of mobile internet connections

key_trends: COVID-19 helped the industry expand rapidly. The forced shutdown of bricks-and-mortar stores accelerated the long-time shift to online dominance.
The rising popularity of e-books has boosted sales and revenue. E-books are a convenient alternative to traditional books as they take up less space and are readily available upon purchase.
The industry is not marred by legal regulation. Online booksellers can operate all but unimpeded, with the exception of tax laws pertaining to digital sales.
Several industry associations exist to support online booksellers. The Internet Merchants Association is perhaps the most prominent of these groups.
Hardcover books are the most popular product offered by the industry. These books are more expensive to produce, though these production costs are easily passed down to the consumer.
Younger generations have embraced online shopping.

market_segmentation.segment_description: On average, older members of this group (i.e., individuals between 25 and 44 years old) spend more than younger segment members.
Consumers between 45 and 64 years old are the second-largest source demographic for industry sales.
Individuals in this category typically have significant amounts of free time to spend on leisure activities.

products_and_services.product_description: Hardcover books, which are defined as stable or stitch-bound books with rigid covers, are much more durable, and therefore, costlier to manufacture and sell.
Paperback books are also referred to as mass-market paperback books (MMPBs) by sellers and are inexpensively printed for large audiences.
E-books are largely electronic versions of books that already exist in print. Greater mainstream popularity of e-books has been closely tied to the introduction of handheld devices.

tier_1_suppliers: Cardboard Box & Container Manufacturing in the US
Plastic & Resin Manufacturing in the US
Synthetic Fiber Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Book, Magazine & Newspaper Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The percentage of services conducted online reflects consumer preferences toward purchasing items and conducting services online.
Students are required to purchase textbooks throughout their higher education.
Mobile connections enable consumers to buy books online and, more importantly, e-books on-the-go.
Books are a discretionary household expenditure; consumers generally read books for pleasure or for educational purposes.

business_locations.location_description: Silicon Valley is the main location for online booksellers. This is because it's the headquarters of Amazon, the industry's largest participant.
The Southeast is a major region for the industry. This is because the region has the largest population in the country.
The West is the single-largest region for the industry. Amazon, the industry's largest online seller, is headquartered in Silicon Valley.
The Mid-Atlantic is the third-largest region for the industry.
Is in the center of the United States.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry is subject to rules that apply to all e-commerce businesses.
The primary law concerning copyrighted works.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance level is low and steady.
Competition level is high and increasing.

basis_points.basis_description: All sellers compete with Amazon, the biggest force in the industry.

basis_points.basis_title: Bricks-and-mortar stores still conduct significant business
basis_points.basis_description: Bricks-and-mortar stores still conduct a significant amount of business.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Online Book Sales industry is highly concentrated, dominated by the presence of Amazon.
Amazon is one of the largest online retail networks.
Other companies exist in the online book marketplace.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Stable or stitch-bound books with rigid covers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new technologies is low.
The concentration of technologies is high in this industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of books?
FAQs.answer: Online book sellers in this industry are best able to establish their presence through a niche given Amazon's control of the overall marketplace.

FAQs.question: How has the shift toward conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The move toward online purchasing of both physical and digital books has given companies like Amazon stronger purchasing power.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with publishers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Larger and well-known operators benefit from working directly with publishers to reduce purchase costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Less labor is needed for online and e-book sales.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to keep up with rapidly changing digital interfaces?
FAQs.answer: E-book companies are steadily changing and evolving their products.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology?
FAQs.answer: Amazon is one of the leading providers of multiple technologies.
